title: Ram-Headed God
description: Seated ram-headed deity in bronze. The god wears a shendyt kilt. Both hands are held, clenched in fists, atop his knees. A break atop his head indicates that he was once crowned with some object, probably a solar disk. If so, he might be identified as either Amun-Re or Khnum-Re.

museum_location.name: This item is not on view

completeness.name: Best
completeness.description: All data has been vetted. Objects generally have quality photos and descriptions.

labels.title: 37.682E
labels.content: The Egyptians represented the creator god Khnum with the head of a long-horned ram on a human body. Particular individual rams were treated as deities in life. As incarnations of the god, they were then mummified at death and buried with great ceremony.

collections.name: Egyptian, Classical, Ancient Near Eastern Art

exhibitions.title: Soulful Creatures: Animal Mummies in Ancient Egypt
